text: The superb lyrebird (Menura novaehollandiae) is a pheasant-sized songbird. It is an Australian endemic species, about 100cm long. It has brown upper body plumage, grayish-brown below, rounded wings and strong legs. It is the longest and third heaviest of all songbirds. They are capable of mimicking a wide variety of sounds, including other bird's songs and man-made sounds like car alarms and chainsaws. Category:Passeri Category:Birds of Australia
title: Superb lyrebird
